lines.text: Is that a star?
No, that's Ted Danson.
I suspect that your version of romance is whatever will separate me from my panties.
No, I am just talking about dinner. Wear make-up, put on a dress. Panties are optional.
The music's stopped.
What music?
At the risk of sounding schmaltzy, I just want to tell you that you're a schmuck, and I hope I never see you again.
[after Ben asks about how everyone is in Grady]
Why don't ask me about Vialula?
Well, she and Hank are probably...
You're in my chair.
[Ben looks up at Hank]
Slide a bit, Nancy Lee.
[sits down]
There is a man in the toilet sellin' after shave. Now, what's that all about?
Wo,who are you?
Don't tease me.
No I'm serious.You look a lot like Lou,but you're a lot prettier.
I'm warning you Stone,I could probably whoop you in a fistfight.
If you tell me you're here for a physical,you're gonna make my day.
It's unprofessional to flirt with the patients.
I'm just on my way to Beverley Hills.Plastic surgery.Not that you'd need any.
Nice try.
What are you talking about?
Timing. Same thing with women. And with southern women, well, they require a substantial commitment. You might have to stay here six months, I don't know, maybe more.
Are you a betting man, Nick?
Well, I have been known on occasion.
It'll take me about a week.
Wait a minute, you mean... Vialula in the center pocket?
[after skinny-dipping in the lake]
You can blink now.
I don't need a car. I'm moving to Los Angeles. Why would I need a car?
Beverly Hills. The most beautiful women in the world. Plastic surgery. What do these three things have in common? Me, in less than a week.
You want to trade, the pig for the part?
If you can part with the pig.
Good.
I read somewhere that doctors have the highest suicide rate in any profession except for dentistry.
[in reference to L.A]
I heard the women out there have their chest enlarged, their thighs vacuumed, and barf on purpose.

[slaps Hank in the back of the head]
Not while people are eatin'
There's a blurred spot in my vision... there... no, there, no,no...
[Dr. Stone takes her glasses and cleans them]
I'm cured.
I hate a tight hat!

[reading from a note left by Doc Hogue]
"When to call me, you've been stabbed, shot, poisoned, separated from an appendage, knocked or beaten unconscious, run over by a tractor mower, or generally about to bleed to death. Otherwise, leave me alone"

[about being stuck in Grady]
I'm trapped in this HeeHaw Hell.

[while being examined]
Check Hollywood for knives. I don't want him operating in case I sneeze or something.

[to Ben, listening to Dr. Hogue talking]
He'll recite a complete Walt Whitman if you don't monitor his drinkin.

[furious]
You can't reimburse me for a fence i built myself!
Don't let old Doc Hogue scare you. We know you weren't aiming to kill that boy last night.

[about the gossip in Grady]
Can't poop in this town without everybody knowin' what color it is.
I'm going for breakfast, you want anything?
mmm-hmmm, how about Bob Barker?

[snorts]
I'll see what I can do.

[the welcoming committee is discussing Ben's love life]
Maybe he's engaging in the love that dare not speak it's name.
Will I go blind?
[Clarifying, holding up his glass]
This is moonshine, right?

Okay,let's get something straight right now.I got eight years of higher education,I got one year of internship,I got one year of residency.I'm 70'000 dollars in debt.Now I'm waylaid in this heehaw hell,and you insist on clocking me in and out like I'm some kind of factory worker.Well no!N-O,no!This is where I draw the line.

Listen,doctor,I've got a boy here in cardiac crisis.You can't treat that with Coca-Cola or Bisquick.We're gonna have to use real medicine this time.Now I'm sending him to Athens General.You're his regular fucking doctor,you get your fat ass out of bed,get down there and go with him.

Well,nice work,Hollywood.You were just about to crack open the chest of a 6 year-old boy to cure a case of diarrhea.Now,listen up smart ass.Next time I tell you how to treat a patient of mine,you'd better damn well do it,doctor.I doubt you'd know crap from Crisco.
I am so fucked.
Watch your language doc.You're in the buckle of the bible belt here.Try saying fudge or something.
Fiddlesticks too strong?
Depends.
Presidents come here during the fishing season.
On purpose?
Are you allergic to penicillin?
Don't know.You'd have to ask doc Hogue.
I doubt doc Hogue knows it's even been discovered.
Tell us about real doctoring Stone.You know,big-city medicine.
Well so much has changed in the forty years since you went to medical school doctor,I really wouldn't know where to start.
Smart-ass.
What are you talking about?
Timing. Same thing with women. And with southern women, well, they require a substantial commitment. You might have to stay here six months, I don't know, maybe more.
Are you a betting man, Nick?
Well, I have been known on occasion.
It'll take me about a week.
Wait a minute, you mean... Vialula in the center pocket?
